data.title: hot tub weekend
data.text: Positives: bed was comfortable, and the hot tub was amazing! Negatives: no fridge and no microwave available in the room and the room interiors seem quite old. However, there is a microwave out in the lobby. The location is good: halfway between Ann Arbor and Detroit.

data.title: Blow It UP!
data.text: This Hotel is an embarrassment to the Radisson name.  It looks like an old run down hotel that they purchased and slapped their name on it. I would not recommend anyone staying here for more than $40 a night.  The place needs to be totally redone from top to bottom.  I am very surprised in the terrible shape of the rooms.

data.title: Very nice and reasonably priced
data.text: I've  stated this particular hotel quite a few times. I always have a five-star experience. The beds are very comfortable and so are the pillows. I've used their workout center a few times and always get a good workout.. Love their breakfast Buffett

data.title: The best halloween weekend party..& service.
data.text:
We go monthly & sometimes twice monthly .
I live way on 23 mile & he lives Pontiac..
The location is great ..
We feel welcomed & the hotel is exquisite well worth every penny.
The new bar is phenomenal & quick & accomidatting.
I'm glad our social group & hotel was able to do a new contract .

data.title: Poor service
data.text: I reserved a suite for 2 nights, on check in I was told there was no room for me the second night. Then was charged a $250 smoking fee and I don't smoke. The manager promised the fee returned, which did not happen.

owner_response.author: CarlsonRezidor, Online Customer Care at Radisson Hotel Detroit-Farmington Hills, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are very sorry to hear about the disappointing service that you received from the hotel. We do apologize that the hotel was not able to accommodate you for the 2nd night of your reservation and that you were charged a smoking fee. We will be sure to further investigate this with the hotel management to ensure we are provide the kind of service that Radisson is known for.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not to Radisson Standards
data.text: From check-in to housekeeping, disappointed in my experience.  Clerk on late Monday night check-in seemed to be bothered by my arrival.  Robotic and unpleasant, when a simple (and typical) verification on my planned stay would have avoided a booking error that had me checking out a day early.  This was resolved by a phone call from the property which kindly extended my stay one day.  Housekeeping was inadequate 2 of the 4 nights I stayed.  Trash not emptied, soiled towels removed but not replaced, dirty coffee cups left on work-table and sink, and coffee supply not replenished.  Be wary of the elevator in the west wing as the door opens and closes at varying rates and sometimes not all the way.  Rate for the quality of the room appropriate, just not to the standards I expect from the Radisson brand.

owner_response.author: CarlsonRezidor, Online Customer Care at Radisson Hotel Detroit-Farmington Hills, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are very sorry to hear that your recent stay was not up to the standards that you have come to know from Radisson hotels. We do apologize for the disappointing service that you received from the hotel staff both front desk and housekeeping. We also want to say how sorry we are that your room was not cleaned during your stay. We will make sure to speak to the head of housekeeping and to the hotel front desk staff to ensure that not only are we proving our best service but that all rooms are being cleaned properly and up to the standards that Radisson is known for.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Birthday Celebration
data.text: My husband and I held a 90th Birthday celebration for his mother. The event planner did a very good job with our needs. We had to plan everything sight unseen because we were 2000 miles away. They made everything seamless.

data.title: It'd not good... Or great.... It's just fine.
data.text: If you're reading this, this is a fine hotel.. Just fine. It's not God, or great, or even okay... Just fine. Here's nothing wrong with fine hotel. But I was expecting a good one. The exterior sign over main door isn't a real sign, it's vinyl banner. The staff are nice but overworked. The room is a bit dated but as clean as they can possible get it. The in room signs advertise an app for your phone that allows you can to order room service... It doesn't work. You'll order food but the order never makes it to the kitchen. Would I return? No. There are nicer hotels for the same price in the same area.

owner_response.author: CarlsonRezidor, Online Customer Care at Radisson Hotel Detroit-Farmington Hills, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are very sorry to hear about your recent stay. We do apologize that you were not very impressed by the hotel. We also want to say that we are sorry that the food app was not working properly. We will make sure to address your concerns with the hotel management so that we can better improve the hotel.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ice cold pool and dirty room
data.text: Mold in the hvac door frames, pop all over the walls, ceiling and bathroom door, dust in the air vents.  Simple cleaning steps were not taken after we pointed out the issues to the housekeeping manager.... not even wiping the pop off the wall.  BTW, this was an upgraded suite too :o.

owner_response.author: CarlsonRezidor, Online Customer Care Specialist at Radisson Hotel Detroit-Farmington Hills, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We appreciate your taking time to write your review. Please accept our apologies for the lack of cleanliness to your room as well as the staff service received.

Usually this is not the standard of our service and we always strive to accommodate our guests in the most effective manner.
 
Your concerns have been shared with all staff to ensure the Radisson standard is upheld for all guests.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Should have requested a different room. I was "upgraded" to a king suite with a whirlpool tub as a silver club member. I was immediately met with the smell of urine in the bathroom which pretty much set the tone of my stay. Signs were posted of the no smoking policy (Michigan State law) and when the smell of a neighboring room smoking became overwhelming and I called the front desk, clerk seemed flustered and nothing was done to follow up or remedy situation. Glasses and mugs in room were not clean. Pretty much felt I was in an unclean room. Upon checkout, not even asked if my stay was pleasant.

owner_response.author: HotelFH, Front Office Manager at Radisson Hotel Detroit-Farmington Hills, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Roger,

Thank you for taking the time out of your day to provide us with honest feedback regarding your stay. Your comments have been heard and I'd like you to know that I'll be personally following up with our senior management and housekeeping staff to ensure a similar situation does not occur in the future. Please accept my apologies. I have reached out to you personally and, should you wish to discuss your experience further, encourage you to contact me. 

Thank you,

Jonathan Frederick
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent stay
data.text: Overall, it was a great experience. Our poolside room was equipped with a sliding door which open directly to the indoor pool. Only issue I saw was that our shower head leaked and there was some water damage to the ceiling tiles. Nothing major.

data.title: Worst Traffic You May Ever Experience
data.text: This hotel is adequate for a short stay, but it has seen it's better days.  Strange elevator location, long hallways that seem to have been designed by an architect on crack, and a lack of maintenance characterize this hotel.  The hotel location could not be worse in terms of the HUGE amount of automobile traffic in the area.

data.title: Still not a bad hotel
data.text: It's been a year since I stayed here, at that time it just changed over to the Radisson and they were in the process of remodeling some of the rooms. Well a year later and some of the rooms are still in the process of being remodeled the room I received had a bracket high over the desk I would assume was to hold a picture in place because of the hole further down to anchor it too. also there were hole in the wall next to the bed which appear to be where pictures were hanging and in the bathroom above and below the mirror and the jetted tub did not work and the furniture was starting to show its age. But the room itself was clean and the staff were some of the friendliest I have ever met at any hotel. This hotel is on my list of places to stay when I am in the area

data.title: Great place to stay
data.text: For me, the Radisson Hotel in Farmington Hills has been a great place to stay. On many occasions I have brought family members with me and we all have been very happy  with the kind & caring treatment we recieved by the super friendly staff from beginning to end.

data.title: With the Upscale Community Surrounding the Hotel, This Hotel Has A Lot To Work On!
data.text: Don't expect the red carpet at this hotel.  From a dilapidated outdated king suite with Jacuzzi, to a business model in which the hotel cares not to make any money from their guests are all reasons to avoid this hotel at this location at all costs.

owner_response.author: CarlsonRezidor, Online customer  at Radisson Hotel Detroit-Farmington Hills, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for reaching out and writing your review.  We are sorry you were not satisfied with the accommodations of your suite.  We will review the conditions of your room with our housekeeping staff to ensure all guest rooms are up to Radisson Hotels standards.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great location
data.text:
I always enjoy the hotel with my groups events .. my issues are minor but important to me !
I also love the security they do allot more then people are aware of ..
I'm also glad the hotel up dated the dinning area...
And added food items ..
I sometimes don't order out know ...

data.title: Beautiful room
data.text: We booked two rooms this weekend at Radisson Farmington Hills MI.   The rooms were large and clean.  The front desk was accommodating in moving us to the third floor when we checked in.    Wish the rooms had a small fridge but that is our only complaint!

data.title: Maintenance
data.text: Lack of inspections and reporting issues with rooms. wet stained ceiling tiles in room. exhaust fan in bath hanging out of ceiling. Hair Dryer missing. No inner liner in Bath/Shower. Dirty swimming pool.

owner_response.author: HotelFH, Front Office Manager at Radisson Hotel Detroit-Farmington Hills, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
On behalf of our entire staff at the Radisson Farmington Hills, I apologize for your recent experience at our hotel. I'd like you to know that I have personally addressed the issues you have brought to my attention with our maintenance and housekeeping staff. I'm also excited to let you know that all of our 201 guest rooms will be undergoing complete renovation later this year. We hope you'll return and give us another opportunity to meet and exceed your expectations. 

Thank you for your time and, once again, our apologies. 

Jonathan Frederick
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel
data.text: Nice size hotel great area and very nice staff also I have good tv Chanel's to pick from its was a great experience and I would return only thing I suggest is that the beds be little bigger make it was being I was in two bed room so it was small but it was nice

data.title: hotel a bit dated
data.text: check in was smooth enough, i did not get the impression they were very welcoming. The room i was given had no working a/c. The room was hot. I tried to get it working for a while then called the front desk. They said they would send someone up to check. Maintenance came and tried to set it (like i had for half an hour), after 15  minutes,  they left and said they would be back in 5 mins, 20 mins later they came back and said they would reset it, after working for 15 mins they said there was no reset button. So they want to change the thermostat. I asked how long and was told 1/2 an hour.....  So after being in a hot room for an hour and a half i was going have to wait longer. I asked for another room and after several discussions they staff finally brought me a key to another room...  So pack everything and move. Finally comfortable. seems a lot of hassle
